oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Chet Atkins interview - Biff Collie Inside Nashville
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Recording of an interview with Chet Atkins (performer/producer), conducted by Biff Collie (host) for his radio program Inside Nashville.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Biff Collie asks about Elvis Presley -- Chet Atkins talks about Elvis being shy when he was by himself and that he had good manners -- Atkins talks about producing and playing alongside Elvis -- Atkins talks about Elvis contributing quite a bit during recording sessions -- Atkins talks about how Elvis had a bad effect on the studio members Chet worked with, in that they thought they had to be just like Elvis -- Atkins talks about how Elvis was one of the first stars who had the image to go along with the rock and roll music -- Atkins talks about Elvis popularizing the imitation of African American performers, referred to as blue eyed soul -- Atkins talks about the popular opinion that Elvis introduced the popularity of the guitar in music, which he claims is untrue -- Atkins says he never worked with Bob Dylan -- Atkins talks about seeing himself has a person who had a little talent, was fairly bright, and had a burning passion to play guitar, and he had no idea why -- Atkins says that he sees himself as a fair producer working with a good company -- Atkins talks about how he is always nice to others at the expense of not being nice to himself -- Atkins talks about always being a student of the guitar and that styles of playing are always changing -- Atkins talks about his style of guitar playing -- Atkins talks about getting terrible interview questions -- Collie concludes the interview -- Chet Atkins does introductions for this interview and other programs hosted by Biff Collie [x6]
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Collie, Biff; Atkins, Chet, 1924-2001;
